org.vadere.state.simulation

Class Trajectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vadere.state.simulation.Trajectory

  • public class Trajectory
extends java.lang.Object
    A Trajectory is a list of Pedestrian objects, that can be seen as pedestrian states of the same pedestrian. The representing pedestrian is the same, so all Pedestrian objects has the same id but the state of a pedestrian changes over time.

      • getAgent

        public java.util.Optional<Agent> getAgent(Step step)
        Returns an Optional object. If the pedestrain has not appeared at step, the method will return the pedestrian at the first step it is alive. If the pedestrain has disappeared at step, this method return the pedestrian at the last step it is alive.
        Parameters:
        step - the time step that specify the pedestrian
        Returns:
        an Optional object which is empty if the trajectory is completely empty.

      • getPositionsReverse

        public java.util.stream.Stream<VPoint> getPositionsReverse(Step step)
        Return a java.util.stream.Stream<> stream of VPoint pedestrian positions from the first step (1) to the (step.getStepNumber()) in reverse order.
        Parameters:
        step - the step of the last pedestrian position
        Returns:
        a stream of pedestrian positions to from 1 to step.getStepNumber() in reverse order
